channel.title: Getting Started on Hugo Techdoc Theme
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on Hugo Techdoc Theme

item.title: Installation
item.description: Install Hugo theme on your project If you have git installed, you can include hugo-theme-techdoc repository into your core repository as submodule using git submodule within your project directory. cd your_project git submodule add https://github.com/thingsym/hugo-theme-techdoc.git themes/hugo-theme-techdoc For more information read the Hugo documentation. Or download Hugo theme on your project If you have git installed, you can do the following at the command-line-interface within your project directory. cd your_project/themes git clone https://github.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: You may specify options in hugo.toml (or hugo.yaml/hugo.json) of your site to make use of this themeâ€™s features. For an example of hugo.toml, see hugo.toml in exampleSite. Params # Source Code repository section description = "put your description" github_repository = "https://github.com/thingsym/hugo-theme-techdoc" version = "1.0.2" # Documentation repository section # documentation repository (set edit link to documentation repository) github_doc_repository = "https://github.com/thingsym/hugo-theme-techdoc" github_doc_repository_branch = "master" github_doc_repository_path = "" # Analytic section google_analytics_id = "" # Your Google Analytics tracking id tag_manager_container_id = "" # Your Google Tag Manager container id google_site_verification = "" # Your Google Site Verification for Search Console # Open Graph and Twitter Cards settings section # Open Graph settings for each page are set on the front matter.
